page.title: 11Science and Technology
page.content: {December 24 ,1966.} A Llanelli-born flier has been chosen to lead the team of test pilots on the Anglo-French Concorde project. He is Mr.Brian Trubshaw, a member of a well known Llanelli family.He is chief test pilot and special director of the Weybridge division of the British Aircraft Corporation. Mr.Trubshaw has led teams on test flights of the B.A.C.One-11 short-haul twin-jet and the super VC10 long-range jet transport. He is the son of the late Major Harold Trubshaw and Mrs.G.Trubshaw. The Trubshaws used to live at Aelybryn, Felinfoel, which until recently was a W.R.V.S.Home for the aged. In the 1970's the Trubshaw's home was converted into one of the area's leading hotels- called the Diplomat.
